item.title: Dragon Quest VII Reimagined – Emberdale and Wetlock hands-on gameplay, screenshots
item.content:encoded:
Square Enix has released 15 minutes of new Dragon Quest VII Reimagined footage and screenshots as part of first hands-on media previews that went live today.

The footage showcases two areas of the game—Emberdale from earlier on in the story, and Wetlock from a bit further in.

The Emberdale footage follows the heroes as they arrive just in time for the Flaming Festival. Although the town clairvoyant has predicted that the volcano central to the celebration will erupt that same day, the festivities push forward with the help of the heroes, who investigate the cause behind the clairvoyant’s prediction.

  • ❮
  • ❯

The Wetlock footage opens with an elderly bard arriving in town, playing an enchanting melody that lures the townsfolk into a portal connected to Highendreigh Tower, intending to protect them from a foretold flood. And so the heroes set out to uncover the source of the disaster.

This segment also highlights the new Moonlighting system, which allows each character to “moonlight” as a second vocation alongside their main class, unlocking the potential for various skill combinations. For example, your hero can be both a Sailor and a Thief, Maribel can be a Priestess and Mage, or Ruff can be both a Martial Artist and Warrior. Unlike the original Dragon Quest VII: Fragments of the Forgotten Path, which required players to visit a specific location to change vocations, you can now switch at any time simply by pressing down on the d-pad.

The footage also features a brief look at the game’s new tab-based menus, a first for the Dragon Quest series. While previous Dragon Quest games have featured the more classic window-based menus, Dragon Quest VII Reimagined adopts a more modern interface for more comfortable navigation.

Dragon Quest VII Reimagined is due out for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, Switch, and PC via Steam and Microsoft Store on February 5, 2026 worldwide. Read more about the game here here, and here.

Watch the gameplay below. View the screenshots at the gallery.

Emberdale Area Gameplay

Entering Emberdale

Flaming Festival

Burnmont & Glowering Inferno

Wetlock Area Gameplay

Entering Wetlock

Highendreigh Tower

Spilton-on-Sea & Gracos

item.title: PICROSS S SNK Classics & NEOGEO edition announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out on November 27.

Jupiter has announced PICROSS S SNK Classics & NEOGEO edition for Switch. It will launch via Nintendo eShop on November 27 for $17.99 / €17.99 / £16.19 / ¥1,800.

Here is an overview of the game, via Jupiter:

About

Characters from SNK‘s arcade and NEOGEO titles appear in the PICROSS S series!

By solving Picross puzzles, you’ll see pixelated illustrations of nostalgic characters, familiar characters from the ongoing series, and famous scenes.

PICROSS is a picture crossword puzzle game in which you complete pictures using numbers as clues. With simple, easy-to-understand rules, anyone can enjoy it.

You can also solve PICROSS puzzles with family and friends, so you can enjoy the nostalgia of SNK’s retro games while making new discoveries at the same time.

There are 150 questions each for “Picross” and “Mega Picross,” five for “Clip Picross,” and 40 for each of the piece puzzles, for a total of 200 questions, 30 for “Color Picross,” and five for “Extra.”

The “Time Attack” mode, in which you aim to complete Picross within the time limit, features 30 carefully selected Picross questions.

New Features

  • In the “Art Gallery” you can take a closer look at the key visuals used in the backgrounds.
  • By enabling the “Puzzle Board Coordinates Guide” option, you can easily specify rows and squares.
  • On Nintendo Switch 2, the Joy-Con 2 (R) mouse function is supported.
    • Mouse function is not available in the trial version.

Watch the announcement trailer below. View the first screenshots at the gallery.

Announce Trailer

English

Japanese

Screenshots

  • ❮
  • ❯


https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/picross-s-snk-classics-neogeo-edition-announced-for-switch

item.title: PICROSS S Capcom Classics edition announced for Switch
item.content:encoded:
• Switch

Due out on November 27.

Jupiter has announced PICROSS S Capcom Classics edition for Switch. It will launch via Nintendo eShop on November 27 for $17.99 / €17.99 / £16.19 / ¥1,800.

Here is an overview of the game, via Jupiter:

About

Characters from Capcom‘s retro console titles appear in the PICROSS S series!

By solving Picross puzzles, you’ll see pixelated illustrations of nostalgic characters, familiar characters from the ongoing series, and famous scenes.

PICROSS is a picture crossword puzzle game in which you complete pictures using numbers as clues. With simple, easy-to-understand rules, anyone can enjoy it.

You can also solve PICROSS puzzles with family and friends, so you can enjoy the nostalgia of Capcom’s retro games while making new discoveries at the same time.

There are 150 questions each for “Picross” and “Mega Picross,” five for “Clip Picross,” and 40 for each of the piece puzzles, for a total of 200 questions, 30 for “Color Picross,” and five for “Extra.”

The “Time Attack” mode, in which you aim to complete Picross within the time limit, features 30 carefully selected Picross questions.

New Features

  • By enabling the “Puzzle Board Coordinates Guide” option, you can easily specify rows and squares.
